text: Hi all. Couldn't find this in the docs, but maybe I'm skimming something. What's the minimum access requirements needed for someone to register a package? I have merge access, but when I attempt to register a patch on juliahub it tells me I'm not in the contributor list. Does that mean only admins can submit registration? (completely fine if that's the case, just couldn't find it in any docs).

elements.text: Hi all. Couldn't find this in the docs, but maybe I'm skimming something. What's the minimum access requirements needed for someone to register a package? I have merge access, but when I attempt to register a patch on juliahub it tells me I'm not in the contributor list. Does that mean only admins can submit registration? (completely fine if that's the case, just couldn't find it in any docs).

text: Is the package in an org, or someone's personal account?

elements.text: Is the package in an org, or someone's personal account?

text: If you say which package, <@U6B38J8KV> can take a look.
You need to be in the list of contributors of the package or the package needs to be under your GitHub account.

elements.text: You need to be in the list of contributors of the package or the package needs to be under your GitHub account.

text: I'm now an admin, so I guess it's less of an issue for next patch?

elements.text: I'm now an admin, so I guess it's less of an issue for next patch?

text: It's probably just a timing issue. Whilst I've done a bunch of reviews and edits of PRs on this repo, since we're squashing commits with our merges I guess this latest PR is the only time I actually show up as a contributor.
